title: Turn the camera off during your online chats to drastically cut emissions
lead: Turning on the camera emits 25 times more CO2 than calling using voice alone!

title: Drax launches initiative to improve green skills for one million people
lead: Its ‘Mobilising a Million’ programme aims to boost the ‘social mobility’ of people and improve their employability

title: Centrica CFO quits after less than a year in post
lead: Kate Ringrose, who has been with Centrica for 16 years and has most recently been Group Financial Controller, will take over as CFO with immediate effect

title: IEA: Almost 70m tonnes of methane emitted by global oil and gas industry in 2020
lead: The amount is equivalent to the total energy-related carbon dioxide emissions of the European Union

title: US oil giant Chevron invests in carbon capture startup to shrink its carbon footprint
lead: The two companies have also signed a letter of intent to collaborate on potential pilot projects

title: Equinor makes a splash with ‘world’s first’ project to trial floating solar in rough waters
lead: The pilot plant will be trialled in the North Sea off the small island of Frøya in Western Norway

title: Moray East successfully installs first wind turbine in Moray Firth
lead: In total it plans to put 100 9.5MW turbines into place at the site, following the completion of jacket installation in December

title: UK Export Finance appoints renewables specialist for northern England
lead: She will support energy companies in securing finance for export contracts and connecting them to green projects overseas

title: Global power consumption ‘to almost double by 2050’
lead: A new report predicts half of global power generation will come from renewables by 2035

title: RWE to develop four onshore wind farms in France and Poland
lead: Three of the wind farms will be located in France and one in Poland and will have a total installed capacity of 76MW
